Description: Wall sherd of East Greek (North Ionian) black-figured pottery bowl; thick walled; interior: black slip, reserved tondo edged with a red band; exterior much worn: part of animal frieze with at least a siren or bird; below, bands framing careless billet frieze; glazed near foot attachment.
Bibliographic references: Villing et al 2013-2015 / Naukratis: Greeks in Egypt (GG.285)
